snippet: The court rejected a 22-year sentence for an Algerian man who plotted to bomb a Los Angeles airport on Dec. 31, 1999, saying it “did not properly account” for his crimes.
abstract: Federal appeals court overturns the 22-year prison sentence for Ahmed Ressam, the Algerian national known as the Millennium Bomber, who plotted to set off explosives at Los Angeles International Airport on December 31, 1999; court deems the sentence too lenient.
lead_paragraph: The court rejected a 22-year sentence for an Algerian man who plotted to bomb a Los Angeles airport on Dec. 31, 1999, saying it “did not properly account” for his crimes.

headline.seo: Appeals Court Overturns Millennium Bomb-Plot Sentence
headline.main: Appeals Court Overturns Millennium Bomb-Plot Sentence; Calls it Too Light
headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Overturns Millennium Bomb-Plot Sentence as Too Lenient
